```{r load_data}
library(plotly)

```


## Bar Charts {.tabset .tabset-fade .tabset-pills}
### All Countries
```{r world_bar, fig.width=6, fig.height=10}
p <-
  today_global %>%
  mutate(rnk = row_number(desc(new_cases))) %>%
  filter(rnk < 30) %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = reorder(country, new_cases), y = new_cases)) +
  geom_bar(stat = 'identity') +
  coord_flip()
ggplotly(p)
```
